snippet: Quail are highly social, calling to one another throughout the day - a possible adaptation to living in high-density populations.
abstract: Quail are highly social, calling to one another throughout the day - a possible adaptation to living in high-density populations.
lead_paragraph: Jennifer Gee, a biologist at the Claremont University Consortium and the University of California, Riverside, writes from the tropical dry forest near Álamos, Mexico, where she and Jennifer Calkins are studying Callipepla quail.
